section.title: Support for ISO images
section.para: You can load ISO images into the Image service. You can subsequently boot an ISO image using Compute.

procedure.title: To load an ISO image to an Image service data store

step.para: Obtain the ISO image. For example, ubuntu-13.04-server-amd64.iso.
In the Image service, run the following command:

screen.userinput: glance image-create --name ubuntu.iso \ --is-public True --container-format bare \ --disk-format iso < ubuntu-13.04-server-amd64.iso

step.para: In this command, ubuntu.iso is the name for the ISO image after it is loaded to the Image service, and ubuntu-13.04-server-amd64.iso is the name of the source ISO image.
Optionally, confirm the upload in Compute.

procedure.title: To boot an instance from an ISO image

step.para: In this command, ubuntu.iso is the ISO image, and instance_name is the name of the new instance.
